subject: Web3
title: DAO Legal Structures
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: DAO Legal Structures.

hook.text: A DAO has no CEO, no board, and no incorporation. Current law doesn't know what to do with internet-native organizations.

buildup.text: Without legal status, DAO members could be personally liable for the organization's actions â€” unlimited liability for every voter.

discovery.text: Wyoming, the Marshall Islands, and others created legal wrappers for DAOs â€” limited liability for decentralized groups.

twist.text: Most DAOs haven't adopted legal wrappers. The culture values code over law, even when that's legally dangerous.

climax.text: DAOs need legal frameworks to interact with the real world. Ignoring law doesn't make liability disappear.

punchline.text: A vote in a DAO could make you personally liable. Most voters don't know that.

quiz.question: What legal risk do DAO members face without formal legal structure?
options: Unlimited personal liability for the organization's actions
